document.docAuthor: De Carvalho, Claudio J. B. & Haseyama, Kirstern Lica F.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Polietina (Diptera: Muscidae) from South America, with an updated phylogeny of the genus and a review of species’ identity in GenBank

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Polietina (Diptera: Muscidae) from South America, with an updated phylogeny of the genus and a review of species’ identity in GenBank

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Cyrtoneurina prima
Couri & Machado, 1990 : 659
. Holotype female (MNRJ);
six paratypes females ( MNRJ ). Type locality: Represa dos Ciganos ( Parque Nacional da Tijuca ), Rio de Janeiro , Brazil
.

Polietina nigra Couri & de
Carvalho, 1996 : 825
. Holotype male ( MNRJ ), 15 paratypes females ( MNRJ ). Type locality: Una, Bahia , Brazil . Syn. nov .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks.
Polietina prima
was described by Couri & Machado (1990) in
Cyrtoneurina Giglio-Tos, 1893
based on seven females collected in Represa dos Ciganos (Parque Nacional da Tijuca), Rio de Janeiro . Couri & Pamplona (1997) transferred these species to
Polietina
and re-described it based on type-material ( MNRJ ). Nihei & de Carvalho (2007: 489) included a short description of the male of
P. prima
, indicating that marginal spines process of cercal plate has downwardly orientated spines.
Polietina nigra
was described based on 16 specimens , 1 male ( holotype ) and 14 females ( paratypes ), from Una, Bahia and 1 female ( paratype ) from Rio de Janeiro . For the present manuscript, we analyzed male specimens previously identified as
P. nigra
and
P. prima
. We are not able to find any conspicuous difference between them. The examined male genitalia of both species is very similar to drawings made by Couri & de
Carvalho (1996: figs. 1 – 5)
, even when compared with figures of phallus and associated structures in Nihei & de Carvalho 2003 : figs 1 – 2, where slight difference can be seen in the shape of pregonite. Also, the ovipositor of
Polietina prima
and
Polietina nigra
are very similar ( Couri & Machado 1990 : fig. 2; Couri & Carvalho 1996 : figs. 6 – 7). The only difference in adult chaetotaxy is a variation of the number of setulae on the anteroventral face of the hind tibia, which is used in the key for the identification of species (Nihei & de Carvalho 2007). In the present study, this is considered an intraspecific variation.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 4–8. Male terminalia of
Polietina ponti
sp. nov .
(paratype). 4 : cercal plate, dorsal view, marginal spined processes visible; 5 : cercal plate, ventral view, marginal spined processes omitted; 6 : right surstylus, lateral view; 7 : phallus and associated appendages, lateral view; and 8 : fifth sternite, dorsal view. (Scale bar: 0.2 mm)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Polietina prima
has a wide area of distribution (Löwenberg-Neto & de Carvalho 2013 ), and all specimens were collected in forested sites. It is a synanthropic species collected with banana mixed with ‘ rapadura’ , a Brazilian sweet made from sugar cane (D’Almeida 1993).
Polietina prima
is larviparous, with third instar larvae found in the female abdomen (Couri & de Carvalho 1996 ).

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Character states matrix used in the phylogenetic analysis of
Polietina
(modified from Nihei & de Carvalho 2007). State polymorphism in taxa: A = states 0 and 1; B = states 1 and 2; C = states 0, 1, and 2.? = Missing data; - = inapplicable. See text for explanation.
